Literature Review: Spacecraft-mounted robotics has emerged as a crucial component in various space missions, particularly for in-orbit servicing and maintenance. The increasing demand for robotic systems in space has led to significant advancements in modeling and control techniques. This review aims to provide an overview of the current approaches and new developments in spacecraft-mounted robotic systems, focusing on the use of hypercomplex numbers (dual quaternions) for modeling and control of robotic manipulators.
